page.title: 11CONINGTON - GAZETTEER
page.content: Conington is a tiny village of 150 people situated some 15 kilometres north-west of Cambridge. The village is 2 kilometres south of the A604 trunk road. The small settlement is sited on boulder clay some 15 metres above sea level on the edge of the Fens. The two main structures are the Church and the Hall with the 45 houses in between. Amenities are few with only one public house and one telephone box. Like many surrounding villages, the countryside is open, arable land but the environs of the village is wooded making it a pleasant place.
